building_classifications.description: A single dwelling being a detached house
A boarding house, guest house, hostel or the like
building_classifications.typicalUse: Small-scale boarding houses, hostels with less than 12 residents
building_classifications.notes: Class 1b includes hostels <300m² with <12 residents; larger facilities are Class 3

building_classifications.description: Buildings containing 2 or more sole-occupancy units
building_classifications.typicalUse: Apartments, flats, units above a shared basement/carpark
building_classifications.notes: Class 2 buildings are multi-unit residential buildings

building_classifications.description: Buildings for accommodation of transient guests
building_classifications.notes: Class 3 excludes owner-occupied residences (Class 1/2) and Class 9c care facilities

building_classifications.description: A dwelling in a Class 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9 building
building_classifications.typicalUse: Caretaker's residence, apartment above a shop
building_classifications.notes: Class 4 is a dwelling within a non-residential building

building_classifications.description: An office building used for professional or commercial purposes
building_classifications.typicalUse: Corporate offices, legal firms, accounting services, government agencies
building_classifications.notes: General medical practitioner offices are typically Class 5 unless medical treatment leaves patients non-ambulatory, in which case classified as Class 9a

building_classifications.description: A building for the sale of goods by retail or the supply of services direct to the public
building_classifications.typicalUse: Shops, cafés, hairdressers, kiosks, funeral parlours, supermarkets, department stores
building_classifications.notes: Service stations are Class 6, but auto repair workshops are Class 8

building_classifications.description: A building used for storage, or display of goods or produce
building_classifications.notes: Class 7a is for carparks, Class 7b is for warehouses

building_classifications.description: A building used for the process, production, assembly, repair, servicing, treatment, or testing of goods
building_classifications.notes: Class 8 buildings are for industrial processes

building_classifications.description: A building of a public nature used for healthcare
building_classifications.typicalUse: Hospitals, clinics with day surgery, health labs
building_classifications.notes: Class 9a buildings are for healthcare where patients may require evacuation assistance

building_classifications.description: A building of a public nature used for assembly
building_classifications.typicalUse: Schools, universities, childcare centers, sports stadiums
building_classifications.notes: Class 9b buildings are for assembly purposes

building_classifications.description: A building of a residential nature used for care
building_classifications.typicalUse: Aged care facilities, disability care homes
commonFeatures: Emergency evacuation plans for non-ambulatory residents
building_classifications.notes: Class 9c requires ≥10% of residents to need physical assistance for daily activities/evacuation

building_classifications.description: A fence, mast, antenna, retaining or free-standing wall, swimming pool, or the like
building_classifications.notes: Class 10b includes fences, retaining walls, and swimming pools
Class 10c buildings are specifically for bushfire protection
